page.title: 16Markets.
page.content: The first spadeful of earth from Denton Market Ground was turned on October 10th 1863 by a Mr.John Bentley. In the 1970's the original road pattern was altered to restrict traffic movement around the square. Market days are Wednesdays,Fridays and Saturdays. There are 42 stalls on the market selling a wide diversity of goods. On Wednesdays these stalls are used for traders of second hand goods when the "flea market" operates.The Friday and Saturday markets see an abundance of vegetables and fresh fruit alongside ladies'fashions,beads, hardware,childrens'clothes,bedding, curtains,handbags,haberdashery,cheese, eggs and inexpensive beauty products. One stall sells innumerable buttons. Public toilets,a post office and taxis are available to shoppers.
